drills.title: Wall Ball Throws
drills.video_title: Throwing Progression for Youth Players
instructions: Stand about 10 feet from a wall or fence
Use a 4-seam grip on the ball
Step toward the wall with your glove-side foot
Follow through completely - hand should end at opposite hip
Catch the ball and repeat
coaching_points: Focus on proper grip first - fingers across the seams
Emphasize 'elbow up' before throwing
Watch for stepping toward target, not across body

drills.title: Knee Throwing
drills.video_title: Basic Throwing Mechanics
instructions: Kneel on your throwing-side knee
Partner kneels facing you about 15 feet away
Focus on keeping elbow at shoulder height
Snap wrist on release
Follow through toward partner
coaching_points: Isolates upper body mechanics
Watch for arm slot - should be at or above shoulder
Great for correcting sidearm habits

drills.title: Long Toss
drills.video_title: Youth Baseball Essentials: Simple Throwing Progressions
instructions: Start close (20 feet) and throw easy
Gradually increase distance as arm warms up
For 5-6 year olds, max distance around 40-50 feet
Focus on arc throws, not line drives
Work back in when arm feels loose
coaching_points: Build arm strength safely
Stop if any discomfort
Quality over distance at this age

drills.title: Quick Hands
drills.video_title: Baseball Throwing Drills Youth Players MUST Be Doing
instructions: Stand 10 feet from partner
Catch ball and release as quickly as possible
Focus on transfer from glove to throwing hand
Use proper footwork - small shuffle toward target
Keep throws at chest height
coaching_points: Speed comes from clean footwork, not rushing
Get ball out of glove quickly but under control
Make it a game - count successful quick catches

drills.title: Two Hands Alligator
drills.video_title: Practice Fielding Ground Balls With Four Cones
instructions: Get in ready position - feet wider than shoulders
When ball comes, put glove down with fingers pointing down
Cover glove with throwing hand like an alligator mouth
Squeeze both hands together when ball enters glove
Bring ball to chest, then throw
coaching_points: Two hands ALWAYS - builds habit for ground balls
Alligator 'chomps' on the ball
Start with rolled balls before bounced balls

drills.title: Bare Hand Catches
drills.video_title: How to Teach Kids How to Catch
instructions: Start with soft tennis balls or foam balls
No glove - use both hands to catch
Focus on 'soft hands' - give with the catch
Start close (5 feet) and underhand toss
Move back as confidence builds
coaching_points: Teaches hand-eye coordination without glove distraction
Emphasize 'catch with fingers, not palms'
Use soft balls to remove fear of ball

drills.title: Fly Ball Communication
drills.video_title: 3 great drills for teaching kids how to catch fly balls
instructions: Pair up players in the outfield
Coach lofts fly ball between two players
Player who calls 'I GOT IT!' loudly takes the catch
Other player backs up and says 'YOURS!'
Practice calling ball early and loudly
coaching_points: Communication prevents collisions
Call ball BEFORE you move to it
If you call it, you catch it - no giving up

drills.title: Pop Fly Footwork
drills.video_title: How to Catch A Fly Ball With Confidence
instructions: Start in ready position facing coach
Coach points direction - player takes drop step that way
Run to spot UNDER the ball, not to where it is
Set feet before catch - don't drift
Catch above head with two hands
coaching_points: First step is always back (drop step)
Get to the spot, then wait for ball
Glove above eyes - can see ball into glove

drills.title: Tee Work Basics
drills.video_title: 5 Simple Tee Ball Tips & Drills
instructions: Set tee at belly button height
Feet shoulder-width apart, knees bent
Hands together at back shoulder
Eyes on the ball the entire swing
Swing level through the ball
coaching_points: Watch the bat hit the ball - eyes stay on contact point
Start slow - get smooth before adding power
Hit through the ball, not at it

drills.title: Soft Toss
drills.video_title: Top 3 Tee Ball Drills
instructions: Tosser kneels to the side at 45 degrees
Underhand toss ball into hitting zone
Batter tracks ball and swings level
Focus on timing - let ball get deep
Keep head still through contact
coaching_points: Tosser: consistent location and speed
Batter: wait on the ball, don't reach
Great progression from tee work

drills.title: High-Low Tee Work
drills.video_title: EASY TEE BALL HITTING DRILL
instructions: Set tee at different heights - low, middle, high
Hit 5 balls at each height
Low ball: bend knees more, stay on top
High ball: hands go up, still swing level
Focus on adjusting body, not bat angle
coaching_points: Teaches pitch recognition habits early
Body adjusts, bat path stays consistent
Low = stay tall over ball, High = hands up

drills.title: Front Toss
drills.video_title: 10 Best Baseball Drills for 6 Year Olds
instructions: Coach stands 15-20 feet in front, behind L-screen if available
Underhand pitch into strike zone
Batter loads and swings when ball approaches
Focus on timing and tracking pitch
No power swings - contact focus
coaching_points: Most game-like of tee-ball batting drills
Teaches timing that tee can't
Safety first - use L-screen or stand off to side

drills.title: Ready Position
drills.video_title: How to Field a Ground Ball in 3 Easy Steps
instructions: Feet wider than shoulders, weight on balls of feet
Knees bent, butt down like sitting in a chair
Hands in front, glove open toward batter
Eyes on the hitter - watch the ball off the bat
Be ready to move any direction
coaching_points: Athletic position - like a gorilla or football linebacker
Can't catch what you can't get to - be ready to move
Reset to ready after every pitch

drills.title: Charge and Field
drills.video_title: Practice Fielding Ground Balls - Little League
instructions: Start in ready position
When ball is hit, charge forward aggressively
Slow down as you approach the ball
Field with two hands out front - alligator style
Set feet and make strong throw
coaching_points: Attack the ball - don't wait for it to come to you
Slow to field, fast to throw
Charging creates better hop opportunities

drills.title: Backhand-Forehand
drills.video_title: 10 Best Baseball Fielding Drills for Kids
instructions: Roll balls to glove side (forehand) and throwing side (backhand)
Forehand: field in front of body with two hands
Backhand: extend glove across body, one hand okay
Always get in front of ball when possible
Practice footwork - crossover steps
coaching_points: Forehand is always priority if you can get there
Backhand is a 'save' - use when necessary
Quick feet make hard plays easy

drills.title: Bucket Drill
drills.video_title: 10 Best Baseball Throwing Drills for Kids
instructions: Place bucket or cone at first base
Field ground ball and throw to bucket
Focus on accuracy over power
Get points for hitting the bucket
Make it competitive between players
coaching_points: Throwing to a target beats throwing to a person
Gamification keeps kids engaged
Footwork matters - point front foot at target

drills.title: Home to First
drills.video_title: TEE BALL fundamentals for 5 & 6-year-olds
instructions: Start in batter's box stance
Swing (or pretend swing), then RUN
Run through first base, not to it
Look at base, not at the ball
Touch bag and run 3-4 steps past before slowing
coaching_points: Run THROUGH the base - full speed
Don't look at the ball while running
Head down, pump arms, run straight line

drills.title: Rounding Bases
drills.video_title: 10 Best Baseball Drills for 6 Year Olds
instructions: Start at home plate
Run outside the baseline as you approach first
Touch inside corner of base
Lean into the turn, pump arms
Look for next base while running
coaching_points: Banana path - curve out then in
Touch inside corner to shorten distance
Don't slow down at the base

drills.title: Lead and React
drills.video_title: Youth Baseball Throwing Progression
instructions: Start with foot on base
Take 2-3 shuffle steps off base (coach pitch rules)
Watch coach - 'Go!' means run, 'Back!' means return
React quickly to commands
Practice getting good jump
coaching_points: Small lead for young players - safety first
Explosive first step is everything
Eyes on the ball/pitcher

drills.title: Sliding Practice
drills.video_title: Youth Baseball Essentials
instructions: Start on grass, not dirt
Sit down and practice leg position - one bent, one straight
Hands UP - never down
Practice from standing, then jogging, then running
Progress to base only when comfortable
coaching_points: Safety first - grass, then soft dirt, then base
Hands up prevents jammed fingers
Bent leg goes under, straight leg touches base
